--- In junit@y..., prasad charasala <charasala@y...> wrote:
> Hi all,
>   Just started to explore JUnit. Reading the document
> I am trying to integrate JUnit with IBM Websphere
> Application Developer (Eclipse). When I run sample
> test cases I am getting the following error. Please
> help me.
> 
> Could not connect to: 127.0.0.1:4306
Which build of eclipse are you using?
I'm running stable build 20020125.
Do you have 1.0.2 of the JUnit plug-in?
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/jdt-ui-
home/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.junit/index.html.
[You'll probably have to paste that URL together]

I occasionally see this problem, but usually I rerun
and it works, so I think the port is for communicating
between the workbench and JUnit. I've just seen this
as a minor irritation since JUnit usually works.

Does JUnit ever work for you?
Have you tried the Run with-> Java Application
with a main that uses the junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite())?

Richard.
